text: Miles Oscar Noll (March 30, 1862 – November 27, 1905) was an American clergyman, educator, and college football coach. ==Biography== Noll was born on March 30, 1862 in Lewisburg, Pennsylvania to Hannah Ritter and John Riem Noll. He attended Franklin & Marshall College and graduated around 1885. He married Katherine Merkle Follmer June 25, 1891 in Lewisburg, Pennsylvania. ===Coaching career=== Noll was the first head football coach at Franklin & Marshall College in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, serving for one season, in 1887 season, and compiling a record of 0–2. ===Clergy=== Noll became a pastor and president of the Potomac Synod of the Reformed Church, living in Carlisle, Pennsylvania. ===Death=== Noll died from typhoid fever, on November 27, 1905, in Carlisle. ==Head coaching record== ==References== ==External links== * Category:1862 births Category:1905 deaths Category:Franklin & Marshall Diplomats football coaches Category:Franklin & Marshall College alumni Category:Reformed Church in America ministers Category:People from Lewisburg, Pennsylvania Category:Coaches of American football from Pennsylvania Category:Deaths from typhoid fever
title: Miles O. Noll
